message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.SE 

This paper is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category as it presents a novel approach for conducting a laboratory user study of secure email. It also evaluates the security of three different secure email systems. 

It is also likely to belong to the cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) sub-category as it involves a user study with novice users and presents both quantitative and qualitative results. 

The paper may also belong to the cs.CY (Computers and Society) sub-category as it discusses the grassroots adoption of secure email and the importance of secure communication in society. 

Additionally, it could belong to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category as it involves the exchange of secure email messages between pairs of users. 

Finally, it may belong to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category as it evaluates the effectiveness of different secure email systems.
